alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 6:48PM CST until January 18 at 3:08AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Huntsville AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Big Nance Creek AT Courtland affecting Lawrence County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT THIS EVENING THROUGH EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Big Nance Creek AT Courtland. * WHEN...From this evening through early Tuesday morning * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins on the left bank of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM CST Monday the stage was 14.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM CST Monday was 14.5 feet. - Forecast...The river crested earlier this afternoon and will gradually fall this evening and overnight, before falling below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.6 feet on 01/18/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 315 AM CST.
